fields.description: What I need is to be able to make issue A (e.g. the management issue) depend on a set of other issues in a Version that lives in another project (could be any project). When all the issues in this Version are complete then the management issue will also be complete. Right now I need to *manually* link the issue A to each of the issues associated with a Version, one at a time. If the issues associated with the Version change then I need to manually update issue A. It would be very useful if the set of issues to which issue A is linked were updated automatically. This could be achieved by a "link via" function. One would then be able to link one issue to others via a Version, or a Component, or potentially any other JIRA concept. (I think that Versions and Components are common to most projects.)
fields.summary: Add ability to link issues indirectly via JIRA concepts (e.g. Version & Component)

fields.description:
When JIRA attempts to respond to a trackback ping, it will use the canonical base URL (not the base URL configured under General Configuration).  This can result in situations where:

1. JIRA1 sends out trackback ping to JIRA2 at the URL https://jira2/browse/JSP-110
2. JIRA2 replies with response and encodes its URL as https://jira2:443/browse/JSP-110
3. JIRA1 rejects the trackback response because it doesn't match the originally submitted URL.
fields.summary: Trackback Pings fail on HTTPS links to another JIRA instance

fields.description:
A user in support had their JIRA instance receiving an email with an address that java mail feels is invalid.

This generates a MessageException in the handleMessage method of our email handlers.

javax.mail.internet.AddressException: Illegal whitespace in address in string ``jira_gmitbrazil (APPLICATION)''
at javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress.checkAddress(InternetAddress.java:900)
at javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress.parse(InternetAddress.java:793)
at javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress.parseHeader(InternetAddress.java:554)
at javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage.getAddressHeader(MimeMessage.java:658)
at javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage.getRecipients(MimeMessage.java:483)
at javax.mail.Message.getAllRecipients(Message.java:272)
at javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage.getAllRecipients(MimeMessage.java:498)
at com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.hasRecipient(MailUtils.java:254)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.canHandleMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:206)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler.handleMessage(AbstractCommentHandler.java:55)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:190)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:61)
at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)

The exception propagates up to the MailFetcherService where all we do is log the exception and leave the mail behind. 

In this case we really want to forward the message on to the forward address (if specified).

The problem is that the canHandleMessage call is not inside the try/catch that looks for a message exception.

See JSP-32493 for more details.
fields.summary: When email has an invalid address the mail handlers can throw a MessageException

fields.description:
I am sure I have seen a very similar request already, but I can't find it anywhere so sorry if this is a duplicate. We are finding the workflow system very limiting when it comes to setting the assignee of an issue. Sometimes users need the ability to override the default assignee. You are stuck with either having to go with whomever the system tells you (and without extensions that capability is very limited (in particular because of JRA-5496)), or having to select from a list of all assignable users.

There are several ways to address this issue:
* Make workflow assignement conditional: only use the workflow to set the assignee when a user doesn't select "automatic or unassigned".
* Better: provide a pre-workflow function. This gives users the option to set the assignee before the transition screen appears. So for example, set the assignee to the reporter when an issue is resolved so that the reporter appears in the Resolved Issue screen, but give the user the opportunity to change that selection.
fields.summary: Add workflow "pre-function" as well as post function

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Perform a new search on http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=show&createNew=true
2) Under project, select "A Test Project"
3) Click the "Click here to refresh the search menu" link.
4) In the Custom Fields section, find the "Random text" field and enter the following parameter:  priority:1
5) Click the "View >>" button to perform the search.

Expected results:
Search result contains bugs where the "Random text" field contains the word "priority" or the number "1"

Actual results:
We just searched on the Priority field!  Search result contains priority 1 bugs.

A more common scenario is a user searching for a URL.  They enter http://www.example.com/ into a custom field searcher but get no matches because JIRA is now attempting to search a field called "http".

This bug was fixed for the Summary/Description/Comments/Environment text searcher (which uses MultipleFieldSingleValueLuceneParameter) in JRA-5394.  But this fix does not work for custom text fields (which use SingleFieldSingleValueLuceneParameter).
fields.summary: Colon : in custom field search causes searching of wrong field

fields.description:
Currently, if any anonymous user is considered to own all anonymous comments when it comes to the ability to edit or delete them.
I think this is wrong for two reasons:
* That user is then able to delete comments made by other users even when they only have the "can delete own comments" permission (and ditto for edit).
* This means that anonymous users have some privileges that logged in users don't have.
  A user could edit a comment. Log in, and then no longer be able to edit it. Fairly bizarre.
fields.summary: Anonymous users should not be considered to "own" all anonymous comments.

fields.description:
Hi there,

I've been using Jira to  manage SCRUM teams for several years. The application is great but it lacks a few things that were crutial to our organization: 

1- ability to represent user story with their associated tasks, bugs etc on a hierarchical representation
2- ability to sum-up the efforts of all tasks, bugs etc for any given user story
3- ability to have consolidated efforts at the sprint level

So we decided to create our own Excel based client (see page 2 of attachment). That client was pulling its data directly from the SQL Server DB which creates all sort of problems. 

I am rewriting the tool using Jira SOAP API which is great but I couldn't find anything related to issue linking in the current version of the SOAP API. Would it be a big deal to add that interface shortly?

Best regards,
Louis Frigon
fields.summary: SOAP Interface - Please provide an interface for issue linking

fields.description:
Once a shared dashboard is added by a "subscribing" user to his/her favourites, it's there to stay; seemingly the only ways to remove the dashboard are to:
 (a) have the publisher change permissions on the dashboard so that the subscriber no longer has rights; or
 (b) have the subscriber reset their Dashboard defaults, destroying any private dashboards they have created.

Steps to reproduce:
1. As user A, create a dashboard (let's call it A's Shared Dashboard).
2. Share A's Shared Dashboard to a group to which user B belongs.
3. As user B, search and locate A's Shared Dashboard. Click on the "add to favourites" link (next to the somewhat-too-literal phrase "to add this permanently...")

Observed results:
In Manage Dashboards for user B, A's Shared Dashboard is displayed with only a "Copy" link.

Expected results:
In Manage Dashboards for user B, A's Shared Dashboard is displayed with "Copy" and "Remove" links.

Additional background: we've created team dashboards so that managers/supervisors can see statistics of issues assigned to people reporting to them. To simplify personnel changes, they're created under a (permanent) system admin account, and then shared with the managers. If a manager switches to supervising a different team, they cannot remove the team dashboard for their old team without resetting their dashboard to default (or being removed from, then re-added to, the manager's group, which also affects subscriptions to filters and other dashboards.)
fields.summary: Shared dashboard cannot be removed from Favourites once added

fields.description:
Often when you are looking at an issue in JIRa you need to see some image attached to the issue.

However when you click on them it takes you from the issue information to the image.  hence you lose your "issue" context.

You can do a CTrl-Tab and swicth between tabs however there is a still a loss of context.

Maybe we could have a AJAX popup thingy that displays the image inline to the page via jQuery magic.  I figure it s like the SlideShow thingy in Confluence and a bit like the wiki markup preview thingy.  

The image would be shown inline to the page, with some attention to not overriding the issue information as much as possible.  even if it does cover issue information, it still is less "context" switch in terms of viewing the image attachment.

I would leave the old style image link there and have a preview icon next to it as well.

Apprently in jQuery you can do this in just 1 line :)  (500 chained functions maybe but one line!)

fields.description:
This improvement is related to a *component/framework* JIRA uses.

The plus sign '+' is commonly used to have alternate e-mail addresses, because most mail servers ignore whatever is after the +. The current parser doesn't parse such links because + isn't in the list of valid characters in the UrlUtils.java file.

I made a patch for this so such mails get parsed and linked correctly.It is for oscore 2.2.7
fields.summary: It should be possible to have plus sign in mail addresses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16090].
  {panel}

In our case, we should pick up users who transit issue except reporter and assignee, and show these users' name on screens.
ex. "Verifier" who verify the resolution.

Maybe we can use the useful plugin "JIRA Suite Utilities" to set post-function one by one as below:
1)Copy "temp user" from "Assignee"
2)Assign this issue to Current User
3)Copy "Verifer" from "Assignee"
4)Copy "Assignee" from "temp user"

but it's somehow redundant.
And, I encounter a problem(http://code.google.com/p/jira-suite-utilities/issues/detail?id=66) when jira continuously copy value from field to field. 

Or we should find these user in "Transitions" tab in Issue Details page, but it's useless in search or statistics.

If JIRA offically support a post-function like "Copy Current User to a custom user picker filed", that'll be appreciated.
fields.summary: request for a new post function "Set Current User to a custom user picker field"

fields.description:
Create a custom field (text CF is easiest), then create 2 contexts: one for a project, and one for an issue type (say Bug).
On each context, set the default value to something different e.g. "I am a project" vs "I am a custom field".
Then create an issue in that project with that issue type - the default value for the custom field is the project one. I would have thought since issue types are more specific than projects that the default value would be chosen from the issue type context and not the project?
fields.summary: Custom field default value prefers project specific contexts as opposed to issue type specific contexts

fields.description: The configuration screen for the "Created Vs Resolved" report uses the prototype blue button style popup button. We need to convert this to the standard link style as shown in the Filter selector link of the "Filter Statistics" portlet. This seems to be a carry over from the Charting plugin that we will need to be fixed for other reports and portlets that we pull in from the charting plugin.
fields.summary: Created VS Resolved Issues Report contains Old Filtter / Project Picker

fields.description: Currently to backup a large instance of Jira, it is recommended to use native database backup tools (see [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/automated_backups.html].  So, tools that come with mysql, sql server, or whatever your database happens to be.  It would be nice if the built in backup tool worked on large instances so an external tool was not needed.
fields.summary: Improve the XML backup tool so that it works with larger instances

fields.description: If I am sent a response to an issue I created and then click on the link in the response email, I am sent to a page that tell me I need to authenticate and that provides a link to the login page. This is cumbersome, the login form should be on the page that comes up to tell me I need to log in.
fields.summary: Request for a page redirected to login should go directly to login page

fields.description: In project was deleted all issue. When making new issue in this project the number of issue is not equal "1".  Reset the counter for the project key by directly editing the database is not very well decision since under such approach necessary to overload system.
fields.summary: Necessary to create mechanism of the seting the sequence of the number of the request for project

fields.description:
Update the [JIRA requirements page|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/requirements.html], so that it has a section on browsers we recommend, in addition to the existing list of browsers we support.

Recommended browsers are:
* FF3.0
* IE7
* Safari 3.x

A good template is the Confluence Supported Browsers page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Supported+Browsers
fields.summary: Update the JIRA requirements page, so that it contains recommendations for supported browsers

fields.description:
Link to 'Query Parser Syntax' on [Search Query Syntax|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/querysyntax.html] page is broken.

It looks like the lucene docs are now versioned. So we'll need to keep the link up to date.

JIRA 3.13.x is running Lucene 2.3.2, so the correct link is:
http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_3_2/queryparsersyntax.html
fields.summary: Link to Lucene Query Parser Syntax doc is broken on Search Query Syntax page

fields.description:
After installing these plugins my JIRA server looks strange

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Atlassian+Activity+Stream+Plugin

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Application+Links+Documentation

I have two links to Activity Stream and two links to WIKI ( see picture ), and I get error in Activity Streams(  There was an error gathering activity: Error getting activity from Crucible )

And I have no activity on the WIKI ( No activity was found )

We have JIRA and WIKI in my company , but we don't have FishEye or Crucible

Can you tell me if you see what happen with this install or how to fix the proplem.

Regards,

Einar
fields.summary: After installing these plugins my JIRA server looks strange

fields.description:
The web UI doesn't properly set the colors on form controls (text fields, text areas, combo boxes etc). If the system look and feel uses dark controls with light text (e.g. the Darklooks theme in Fedora), then the form components are still dark in Jira, but the text is set to black. This makes the input forms really hard to use as black text on a dark gray background isn't really easy to read.

See attached screenshots.

Proposed solution:
Wherever input form controls have their font color explicitly set (in CSS or HTML), the background color should also be set. Alternatively: Don't set the foreground color of input form controls at all (and leave it to the system look and feel),
fields.summary: Web UI doesn't properly honor system look and feel in textfields and other controlrs

fields.description:
Hi!

At decision of the issue https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-31453 (In Jira is not imported importance of the date created from CSV-file) we have understood that problem in format csv file (not unique names of the field in the first row csv file). Analysis of the reason has occupied much time. We consider that user interface of the system must give information window that could simplify problem. Please, consider the possibility of the improvement of the system. We wait the answer.

Regards,
Igor.
fields.summary: System must give window with information that format of the imported file not correct and instruction on errors

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:
1) search some issues to do a bulk change to
2) open another browser tab and search some other issues ... just because a collegue called in and wanted some answers
3) go back to the first list an click bulk change
4) -> the bulk change will be applied to the second search list (last one executed) instead of the one displayed on the same page

This should at least be caught to issue a warning to the user. 

There might be a nicer behaviour in such circumstances like: reexecuting the search with the filter settings of that 'page', if the search list displayed isn't the same as the last on executed, might be nice.
fields.summary: bulk link on issue list works on current list and not with the one displayed

fields.description:
when I log the time that I spent on an issue and choose to make it visible for only a certain user group, all other users can still see the time spent on the time tracking bar - time spent.
I think when I report time that I work on an issue as eg "internal eyes only" it should stay internal.
fields.summary: Work log for internal eyes only shows up on the time tracking bar under time spent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Hi,

Is there any way of having the "Attach Screenshot" Operation as an optional field in a Screen? (like Attach File)

Thanks,
Eric
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot as an Operation on the Create Issue screen

fields.description:
Currently, if you add a custom issue type, and you'd like to setup a custom mailhandler to map incoming e-mails to this issue type, user's will have to lookup the issuetype id via a URL in the UI (i.e. by clicking on the edit link for the issue type and looking at the browser location bar).  They then need to enter the id in the mailhander config.

It would be nicer if users could either enter the issuetype name directly in the mailhander config, or if we at least displayed the ids in the UI somewhere.
fields.summary: Make mapping of custom issue types in mail handlers easier
Text effect parsing anomally

fields.description:
The bugzilla importer fails with a stack trace when bugzilla issues contain assignees, reporters and comments by users that do not exist in bugzilla.

{noformat}2008-11-25 18:10:00,543 http-8080-Processor24 INFO [atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean] Exception processing bug id 1
2008-11-25 18:10:00,543 http-8080-Processor24 WARN [web.action.util.BugzillaImport] Exception thrown while importing Bugzilla data
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not create bugzilla user 1, referenced in the bugzilla database.
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createUser(BugzillaImportBean.java:1250)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.getUser(BugzillaImportBean.java:1679)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createIssue(BugzillaImportBean.java:428)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createIssues(BugzillaImportBean.java:369)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.create(BugzillaImportBean.java:245)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.BugzillaImport.doRun(BugzillaImport.java:263)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat}

However the importer gracefully noted that some watchers could not be added due to not existing in the bugzilla database. Not sure if this error was caused by lax referential integrity in older versions of bugzilla, or the old version of mysql. 

A workaround is to alter the bugzilla database such that all bugs and comments refer to users that exist.
fields.summary: Bugzilla import fails when bugzilla issues contain assignees, reporters and comments by users that do not exist in bugzilla

fields.description:
Changes added to JiraCachingPropertySet in v3.13 to make the JiraCachingPropertySet thread-safe are probably over-aggressive in their locking policies.
Reducing the locking for read-only methods that don't update the cache should help reduce lock contention.
fields.summary: Aggressive locking in JiraCachingPropertySet causes high contention

fields.description: This bug is the root cause of CWD-1275. Crowd is checking to make sure that {{null}} is not provided.
fields.summary: When a user saves a search for unassigned issues, JIRA passes null to OSUser UserProvider.handles()

fields.description:
If you try to import a CSV file like this and map the date field:
{noformat}
Summary,Desc,Date Created,Reporter,,,
Test issue, Test issue desc, 21/01/1999 12:00:00, admin, , ,
{noformat}

You'll get a stacktrace when navigating to Step 4 of 5 of the import wizard:
{noformat}
2008-11-28 08:52:30,059 http-8090-Processor2 WARN [jira.imports.csv.CsvConfigBean] Unable to find date fields. Null being returned. 
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.Arrays$ArrayList cannot be cast to java.lang.String
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.csv.CsvConfigBean.getDateFields(CsvConfigBean.java:527)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:61)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:52)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:346)
	at webwork.util.SimpleTest.test(SimpleTest.java:391)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.test(ValueStack.java:129)
	at webwork.view.taglib.IfTag.doStartTag(IfTag.java:38)
	at org.apache.jsp.secure.admin.views.importers.csv.configdateuserdefaults_jsp._jspx_meth_webwork_if_0(configdateuserdefaults_jsp.java:538)
	at org.apache.jsp.secure.admin.views.importers.csv.configdateuserdefaults_jsp._jspx_meth_page_applyDecorator_0(configdateuserdefaults_jsp.java:182)
	at org.apache.jsp.secure.admin.views.importers.csv.configdateuserdefaults_jsp._jspService(configdateuserdefaults_jsp.jav
...
{noformat}
Also, on this step, the user should be prompted for the DateFormat, but it doesn't show up (see screenshot).  This is because somehow the ,,, gets parsed as an array, and the getDateFields() method tries to cast entries to a String.  Our importer code should handle this better, by either reporting an error or by mapping the empty header row fields correctly.
fields.summary: CSV importer can't handle empty trailing commas in header row

fields.description:
Ive just found a bunch of HTML entities in a zip backup causing it to fail.

This causes restores to fail:
{noformat}
Errors
    * Error importing data: org.apache.commons.lang.exception.NestableException: 
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Action][id,35542]
[body,Copyright symbol html entity is Α -->http://htmlhelp.com/reference/html40/entities/][author,aguy][updated,2007-06-12 12:22:32.043]
[created,2007-06-12 12:22:32.043][issue,20512][type,comment][updateauthor,aguy] 
(SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO DB2INST1.jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, 
CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) 
(DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-1218, SQLSTATE=57011, SQLERRMC=4098, DRIVER=3.50.152))
{noformat}

913 is Greek 'Alpha', [http://htmlhelp.com/reference/html40/entities/symbols.html], if there is one, there will be many more.

I'm donning my SED hat to see if I can fix the backup temporarily, however, I would have hoped that the export would have HTML encoded any weird characters so the restore would work (and subsequently _de_code such characters.

If there is a problem in using these characters, Jira should fix the problem on data entry...
fields.summary: HTML entities are not encoded as part of the XML backup, causing failure during restore

fields.description:
See below a point of improvement of Performances

Imagine the following Workflow ...
{code:xml}<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE workflow PUBLIC "-//OpenSymphony Group//DTD OSWorkflow 2.8//EN" "http://www.opensymphony.com/osworkflow/workflow_2_8.dtd">
<workflow>
	...
	<initial-actions>
		<action id="1" name="Create Issue">...</action>
	</initial-actions>

	<common-actions>

		<action id="1010" name="Action_1010" view="comment">
			...
			<restrict-to>
				<conditions>
					<condition type="class">
						<arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AnyCondition</arg>
					</condition>
				</conditions>
			</restrict-to>
			...
		</action>

		<action id="1020" name="Action_1020" view="comment">
			...
			<restrict-to>
				<conditions>
					<condition type="class">
						<arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AnyCondition</arg>
					</condition>
				</conditions>
			</restrict-to>
			...
		</action>

		<action id="1030" name="Action_1030" view="comment">
			...
			<restrict-to>
				<conditions>
					<condition type="class">
						<arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AnyCondition</arg>
					</condition>
				</conditions>
			</restrict-to>
			...
		</action>
	</common-actions>

	<steps>
		<step id="1" name="In Progress">
			...
			<actions>
				<common-action id="10" />
				<common-action id="20" />
				<common-action id="30" />
			</actions>
		</step>
		...
	</steps>
</workflow>{code}

In previous exemple, the com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AnyCondition is evaluate 4 times.
# In Velocity Context preparation
{code:java}IssueSummaryWebComponent.getHtml(IssueSummaryLayoutBean layout, Issue issue, User remoteUser)
...params.put("availableActions", getAvailableActions(issue));{code}
 
# For each iterations in Velocity Template (*templates/jira/issue/summary/issuesummary.vm*)
{code}$summaryComponent.isLazyDecoratable($issue, $action.value)
...IssueUtilsBean.isValidAction(Issue issue, int action)
......IssueUtilsBean.loadAvailableActions(Issue issueObject){code}

When Workflow became more complexe (i.e 3 Transitions from a Step with at least 3 conditions per Transition), and also with more complex conditions, the time allocated to conditions's evaluation is not trivial.

Rgsd
Vincent
fields.summary: Optimisation - Avoid multi evaluation of Condition defined for an Workflow Action

fields.description:
Click on the assignee here https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-115
then click on her "User Filters - Assigned - all" link on the RHS.
The original issue in issue (FE-115) does not appear in the list.

I don't know if this is the root cause, but I assigned that issue to her from the Edit Issue screen. After hitting Submit, the POST was taking a while, and I might have clicked-away (ie I went to another page before the http response had (fully) returned).
Perhaps that interrupted the indexing that JIRA performs on each issue update?
fields.summary: Searching for assigned-to does not find all the appropriate matches

fields.description:
Performance testing results show lots of blocking on ClassLoader.loadClass() being called from OSWorkflowConfigurator.TypeResolver.

Likely we should add a thread safe cache to reduce this.
fields.summary: Reduce lock contention caused by OSWorkflowConfigurator.TypeResolver

fields.description:
JSP fragments /template/standard/filter-list.jsp and /template/standard/portalpage-list.jsp both contain the webwork tag <webwork:property value="./ownerFullName"/>.

The bean "com.atlassian.jira.plugin.profile.FullNameUserFormat.java" method "public String format(String username, String id)" already escapes the string using static method TextUtils.htmlEncode.

According to the webwork property tag documentation the implicitly "escape" attribute is set to "true". Thus if the attribute escape="false" is not set then the string value is doubly escaped.

We should either change the tag to <webwork:property escape="false" value="./ownerFullName"/> or use the <jira:formatuser> tag.
fields.summary: User's fullname is double encoded on the filter and portal list

fields.summary: setting creation date not support in SOAP API

fields.description:
With compliance and audit (SAS-70) seperation of duties is a major issue.  In a larger company I suppose all users could be broken into distinct groups with distinct responsibilities, but for smaller shops this isn't possible and thus enforcing proper seperation of duties isn't really possible currently (that I have been able to see).

Issue JRA-12660 would be a good start, but more advanced options would be ideal.

It would be great to have workflow conditions where you could say a person can only do transition B if they DIDN'T do transition A.

Simple example would be if a workflow requires someone to say the issue is fixed, and then someone else at a later point must say they have tested the fix (user acceptance testing).  For seperation of duties reasons, no matter the persons security group, etc they should not be allowed to both make the fix and also verify it via user acceptance testing.
fields.summary: Workflow "Seperation Of Duties" compliance

fields.description: It would be an asset if the option "View Attachments" (for example "Add comments" option "Viewable by"  and "Download Attachment" are added to the function "Attachments Permissions".
fields.summary: Attachment Permissions - add feature "View" or  "Download"

fields.description:
As administration I need to be able to set the comment view by options depend on roles and to restrict the permission of change it (edit or readonly) so that when the user belong to that role or group the comment field within the issue page set the defual viewable by option and set its view mode depend on the logged in user.
As an example i have 3 parties with different roles
> first role currently logged in then thier comment is viewable by all and they don't have permission to set it to any other option.
> second role thier comment viewable by the third role only
> third role have the permission to set it to all or any other roles
fields.summary: Control comment view permission from administration depend on logged in user
